View_Interfaces

Interface IInfoDialog

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IDialog, IView, java.util.Observer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    InfoDialog

    public interface IInfoDialog
extends IDialog
    This interface is used for dialogs to inform the user about the state of the system. It is based on IDialog and does not need further functionality.

    Usage
    In this dialog the user is informed by a message and a title. The view is shown by IView.showView() and could be manually closed by IView.destruct().
    Caution:
    By making the view visible by calling IView.showView() the current thread will be blocked! This is done to simplify the usage of such info dialogs by a controller. If the thread should not be blocked start this function in a new Thread.

    View actions on view
    The standard buttons of this dialog are:

    • ViewActions.OK - Accepting the information as read
    Further the controller could listen on closing this dialog.

    Creation
    For creating such an dialog please see following functions:

    • IViewFacadeFactory.createInfoDialog(IView, String)
    • IViewFacadeFactory.createInfoDialog(IView, String, String)
    • IViewFacadeFactory.createInfoDialog(IView, String, String[])
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    9045534
    See Also:
    IView, IViewFacadeFactory, IViewFacadeFactory.createInfoDialog(IView, String), IViewFacadeFactory.createInfoDialog(IView, String, String), IViewFacadeFactory.createInfoDialog(IView, String, String[])

    • Method Summary

      • Methods inherited from interface View_Interfaces.IView

        addController, bringToFront, destruct, getViewMenu, showView

      • Methods inherited from interface java.util.Observer

        update
